document.docAuthor: Webb, Donald W. & Metz, Mark A.
document.masterDocTitle: A Revision of the New World Genera Brachylinga Irwin and Lyneborg and Lysilinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) with the Description of a New Genus, Elcaribe Webb

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A Revision of the New World Genera Brachylinga Irwin and Lyneborg and Lysilinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) with the Description of a New Genus, Elcaribe Webb

subSubSection.paragraph: Bi (Latin) = two, twice; color (Latin) = color. This name is used as an adjective and refers to the dark and light coloration of the male parafacial.

Brachylinga bicolor
is taxonomically associated with
B. divaricata
in lacking setae on the katepisternum; in having the postocular, mesonotal, and coxal macrosetae dark reddish brown; in having the male parafacial black ventrally, silver dorsally; and in having the hypoproct quadrate and the posterior margin slightly emarginate.
Brachylinga bicolor
differs from
B. divaricata
in having the gonocoxite ( Fig. 29 ) oblong, tapered apically and lacking short, dark reddish brown macrosetae apicomedially and elongate, dark reddish brown macrosetae anteromedially. Females of
B. bicolor , B. concava
,
B. divaricata
, and
B. ornata
are indistinguishable based on external characters. Internally
B. bicolor
,
B. concava
and
B. ornata
have the spermathecal ducts directed anteriorly ( Figs. 188, 192, 199 ) while in
B. divaricata
the spermathecal ducts are directed laterally before bending at a right angle and continuing anteriorly ( Fig. 194 ).

Head. Length 0.94 mm . Ommatidia smaller ventrally and laterally. Frons silver, dark brown dorsally; setae black. Antenna/head length 0.69; scape and pedicel dark reddish brown, pruinescence gray, flagellum dark brown; scape length 0.21 mm , width 0.14 mm , length/width 1.5, scape/pedicel length 2.7, scape/flagellum width 0.74, setae pale brown, elongate; pedicel length 0.08 mm , length/width 0.6; flagellum length 0.36 mm , width 0.19 mm , length/width 1.9, flagellum/scape length 1.7 times. Parafacial pruinescence black, dorsal half silver. Maxillary palpus dark reddish brown; length 0.42 mm , length/width 7.0; setae pale yellow. Genal setae whitish yellow. Occipital setae whitish yellow, lanceolate dorsally. Postocular macrosetae dark reddish brown.

Thorax. Macrosetae dark reddish brown, 3 np, 2 sa, 1 pa, 2 dc, 2 sc. Mesonotum black; setae black, moderately long intermixed with white, lanceolate, subappressed setae. Pleuron pruinescence silver, dense; setae white on propleuron, anepisternum, laterotergite, metanepisternum, and scutellum, absent on katepisternum. Wing. Membrane pale gray; veins brown; length 5.3 mm , length/width 3.1; pterostigma brown, narrow; cell m 3 closed, petiolate. Halter pale yellow. Legs. Coxa setae white, present on posterior surface of midcoxa; macrosetae dark reddish brown. Femora dark reddish brown, pruinescence white; ventral setae black on fore­ and midfemora; av 0:0:4, pv 0:0:5. Tibiae dark yellow, apical fourth dark reddish brown. Tarsomere 1 dark yellow, apical half dark reddish brown; 2–5 dark reddish brown.
Thorax. Macrosetae 3 np, 2 sa, 1 pa, 2 dc, 2 sc. Wing. Cell m 3 widely open (MEI 106340). Legs. Anteroventral macrosetae 0:0:3–5, pv 0:0:2.
Similar to male except for following.

Head. Frons pruinescence brownish gray, ventral fourth white to silver with large brown circle dorsolaterally; setae dark brown. Scape over 3 times length of pedicel, setae black, short, grading into macrosetae. Parafacial dark reddish brown, silver gray dorsally and laterally.
Thorax. Macrosetae 2–3 np, 2 sa, 1 pa, 2 dc, 2 sc. Mesonotal setae pale gold, lanceolate; scutellar setae pale gold. Legs. Anteroventral macrosetae 0:0:3–5, pv 0:0:4–8.

Abdomen. Coloration highly variable, generally dark reddish brown, tergites 2–6 with posterior margin dark yellow or yellowish orange, tergites 2­6 with posterolateral area of white priunescence. The abdomen may also be dark reddish brown with white pruinescence across posterior margin of tergite 2 and tergites 3–6 with posterolateral area of white priunescence; dorsal setae dark reddish brown on dark reddish brown areas and white appressed across posterior margin of tergites 1–3; lateral setae dark reddish brown.
Terminalia
(MEI 121593) reddish brown. Furca ( Fig. 188 ) oval; length 0.42 mm , width 24 mm ; anterolateral projection absent. Common duct ( Fig. 188 ) shorter than furca. Spermathecal duct ( Fig. 188 ) directed anteriorly.

Brachylinga bicolor
is known from Costa Rica , Mexico , Nicaragua , and Venezuela ( Fig. 217 ).

Brachylinga bicolor
has been handnetted and collected in Malaise traps in rain forest or in pan traps. Specimens have been recorded during every month of the year except for July and October.
